articles.title: DPRK RC Chief Sends Notice to His S. Korean Counterpart
articles.content:
DPRK RC Chief Sends Notice to His South Korean Counterpart
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the C.C., the Red Cross Society of the DPRK Monday afternoon sent another notice to the president of the south Korean Red Cross proposing to have the north-south Red Cross working contact to settle the issue of sending back the DPRK inhabitants now in custody in south Korea as already notified.
					 It is a nonsensical assertion for the south Korean authorities to say they will sent back 27 persons only with those four persons whom the south Korean authorities claimed expressed their intention to "defect" to the south left in south Korea and this can be followed by the discussion of the issue of confirming the four persons' "free will", the notice said, strongly demanding once again them let all 31 detained inhabitants of the DPRK return by their ship through the waters to which they had drifted.  
					
					 The DPRK cannot recognize the "defection" of the four persons as claimed by the south Korean authorities, it held, stressing the need to confirm it through a face-to-face meeting without fail. 
					
					 It suggested the south side to have the contact at the conference room of the former Neutral Nations Supervisory Commission at Panmunjom at 10:00 a.m. on March 9 to make a face-to-face confirmation of those concerned of both sides and their families and relatives, as already notified.
					
					 Considering that the south Korean authorities agreed with the contact in principle, it said that those concerned of the DPRK Red Cross will go to the venue together with families and the conference room of the former Neutral Nations Supervisory Commission in Panmunjom which both sides find convenient is appropriate for the venue of the contact.

articles.title: President of AP Here
articles.content:
President of AP Here
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Thomas Curley, president of the Associated Press of the United States, and his party arrived here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Americans Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Americans Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung 
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Thomas Curley, president of the Associated Press of the United States, and his party visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill on Tuesday.
					 The guests laid bouquets before the statue and paid homage to the President.

articles.title: DPRK Marks International Women's Day
articles.content:
DPRK Marks International Women's Day
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- A national meeting took place at the People's Palace of Culture here on Tuesday to mark the 101st International Women's Day.
					 Attending it were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Rak Hui, vice-premier of the Cabinet, and leading officials of working people's organizations, women officials and women labor innovators.
					
					 Present on invitation were overseas Korean women, women from embassies of different countries and missions of international bodies here and foreign guests.
					
					 Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the C.C., the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, said in her report at the meeting that the unity and solidarity among the world progressive women have been strengthened in the struggle to oppose all sorts of domination and subordination and achieve national independence and social development for over a hundred years since the International Women's Day was instituted.
					
					 The reporter recalled that the women's movement in Korea has advanced along the road of victory and glory under the guidance of the peerlessly great persons.
					
					 In every period and stage of the revolution the Korean women fully displayed their indomitable stamina in the drive for prosperity of the country under the warm care of President Kim Il Sung, she said.
					
					 The women's movement in Korea is now ushering in its heyday under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the reporter said, adding:
					
					 Every page of the records on history of his revolutionary activities is run through with the undying feats he performed by developing the Korean women's movement into a Juche-based movement faithful to the WPK's cause of the Songun revolution.
					
					 The reporter called upon the Korean women to fulfill their mission and duty in defending socialism and achieving the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK and Russian Artistes Give Joint Performance
articles.content:
DPRK and Russian Artistes Give Joint Performance 
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- A joint performance was given by artistes of the Samjiyon Band of the Mansudae Art Troupe of the DPRK and the "Orchestra of the 21st Century" of Russia at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Tuesday on the occasion of the International Women's Day. 
					 The performers included People's Artistes, Merited Artistes, international concours winners and other famous conductors, instrumentalists and vocalists of the DPRK and Russia. 
					
					 They presented mixed chorus "Song in Praise of Women in Songun Era," male solo "My Mother," female solo and women's chorus "Attraction and Reverence," mixed duet "Lily Bell", song of the former Soviet Union, and mixed quartet "I Live for You," Italian song, and other numbers.
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the audience for its high artistry and excellent representation.
					
					  It was appreciated by officials of ministries and national institutions, creators and artistes, media persons and labor innovators here.

articles.title: Exhibition of Construction Equipment Held
articles.content:
Exhibition of Construction Equipment Held
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of construction equipment and tools took place recently in Pyongyang. 
					 It drew construction and building material enterprises taking part in the project of 100,000 homes in the city.
					
					 The exhibits totaled more than 750 kinds.
					
					 They include crane cars, trucks, crankshafts and batteries. 
					
					 After the exhibition the vehicles transported building materials to major construction sites in the capital.

articles.title: Agitation for Increased Coal Production
articles.content:
Agitation for Increased Coal Production
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- National and provincial art squads and city, county and district itinerant art squads have conducted agitation activities for increased production over the last week at major coal mines in Sunchon, Tokchon, Kangdong and other areas.
					 They have joined coal miners in their work and break, encouraging them to boost the coal output.
					
					 They have also given art performances and recreation parties in pits. 
					
					 The Phibada Opera Troupe, the State Folk Art Troupe, the State Theatrical Troupe and Pyongyang Circus dispatched their art squads to mines for agitation activities.
					
					 Encouraged by their activities, the coal mines have topped their daily targets.

articles.title: Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex
articles.content:
Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex 
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, situated in the northeastern part of the DPRK, fulfilled its February plan, 108.6 percent in the total industrial output value and 100.2 percent in pig iron production.
					 At the beginning of the year the complex sent a letter to the workers throughout the country calling for accelerating the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 The complex has played an important role in the development of the country's metal industry and in the building of the self-supporting economy.
					
					 After the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, the workers rehabilitated in a short span of time the smelting furnaces and coke ovens destroyed by fleeing Japanese and produced more pig iron than in the period of the colonial rule.
					
					 They rebuilt the damaged factory after the Korean war and produced 270,000 tons of pig iron from the furnaces with the capacity of 190,000 tons during the great Chollima upswing.
					
					 The complex carried out expansion projects to raise the production capacity, increase the variety of rolled steel and lay foundations for the production of second-stage metal-processing goods.
					
					 It has set up a coke-free steel production system.

articles.title: New Kind of Battery Developed
articles.content:
New Kind of Battery Developed
						
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- A new kind of battery developed by the Catalyst Research Institute of Kim Il Sung University has proved effective in the Anju Area Coal Mining Complex and others.
					 The battery, with a 30-hour discharge, is suitable for mines and collieries.
					
					 As it is airtight, the battery gives no gas emission when being charged.
					
					 The light battery is easy to handle and its serviceable life is three times that of other models.
					
					 Its production cost is 20 percent lower than others.

articles.title: More Animals Find Home in Pyongyang Zoo
articles.content:
More Animals Find Home in Pyongyang Zoo 
						
Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The Central Zoo in Pyongyang welcomed more rare animals. 
					 They are 18 pet dogs of six species, more than 130 parrots of eight species and 50 guinea pigs.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent them to the zoo in last January and February.  
					
					 The zoo is working on providing the animals with a better environment suitable for seasonal conditions.

articles.title: Textile Mill Redolent of Park
articles.content:
Textile Mill Redolent of Park
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The compound of the Pyongyang Textile Mill is as beautiful as a park. Most of its employees are women.
					 Roads inside the mill were lined with trees of more than 100 species.
					
					 The mill has planted many trees in the compound every year to reduce noise pollution and ensure the workers' rest.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il visited the mill on July 30, Juche 98 (2009), the 63rd anniversary of the promulgation of the Law on Sex Equality, and appreciated the mill for having turned the mill into a thick woodland and greenery.
					
					 A fishpond and a health complex were built in the compound for the workers.

articles.title: "Song of Women" Favored by Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
"Song of Women" Favored by Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- "Song of Women" created more than six decades ago represents happiness the Korean women began to enjoy after the liberation of the country from the Japanese colonial rule.
					 It was a favorite song of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					 When meeting some women officials, she told them that a song should be created about the Korean women enjoying happiness after the liberation, free from maltreatment and humiliation.
					
					 When the "Song of Women" was created under her guidance, she appreciated the writer and composer for the good song about women's emancipation. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung, in his lifetime, recalled that Kim Jong Suk liked the song so much.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Lays Bare Criminal Aims of Joint Military Exercises
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Lays Bare Criminal Aims of Joint Military Exercises
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a signed commentary lays bare the aggressive nature, real aim and danger of the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers. 
					 The U.S. warmongers set it as the objective of the on-going joint saber-rattling to "promptly control and eliminate WMDs" of the DPRK and are hurling huge troops of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces including sophisticated war hardware and special units and hundreds of thousands of troops of puppet armed forces into these war maneuvers. 
					
					 This brings to light the U.S. war scenario to mount a surprise attack on the strategic targets and means of the DPRK with the above-said hardware and units and put the DPRK under its control at a single stroke with huge forces.
					
					  What merits a more serious attention is that the escalation of the military exercises to cope with someone's "contingency" is included in the on-going saber-rattling. Herein lie the sinister intention of the U.S. imperialists to invade the DPRK and criminal nature and danger of the on-going exercises.
					
					 The joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. together with the south Korean puppet forces are a vivid expression of its hostile policy towards the DPRK aimed at bringing down its system by force of arms. 
					
					 It is another objective of the joint saber-rattling to stem the trend of detente and dialogue on the Korean Peninsula and escalate the tension there. Lurking behind these moves is a criminal scenario to seek a permanent presence of the U.S. forces in Northeast Asia and reinforce them, build a triangular military alliance involving the U.S., Japan and south Korea for aggression and thus establish its military domination over it.

articles.title: Cooperation with Outsiders Branded as Main Factor of Escalated Tension
articles.content:
Cooperation with Outsiders Branded as Main Factor of Escalated Tension
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities' cooperation with foreign forces is a main factor of escalating the tension in the Korean Peninsula, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined article.
					 They are standing against the fellow countrymen, in cooperation with the aggressive outsiders, and this is treachery and the root cause that spoiled the relations between the north and the south of Korea, the article notes, adding:
					
					 Their call for "priority" to the relations with the U.S. is a treacherous doctrine that reduces south Korea to a full-dress colony of foreign forces and complicates the settlement of the issue of the north-south relations.
					
					"No nukes, opening and 3000 dollars", a "policy toward the north" by the south Korean authorities, are a very sinister policy for confrontation as they set the disarmament and "opening" of the DPRK as a preconditions for improved north-south relations. This is little difference from foreign forces' assertion that the DPRK should "abandon its nuclear program first."
					
					 The U.S. strategy toward Korea is just a strategy for war of aggression on the DPRK. In order to put it into practice, the U.S. has steadily rendered the situation of the Korean Peninsula tense with new war provocations for the last decades.
					
					 To cooperate with such foreign aggressors is a treacherous act of bringing disaster of war to the nation.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' cooperation with foreigners in war moves for aggression on the DPRK is now creating a touch-and-go situation in the peninsula.
					
					 Their military cooperation with the Japanese reactionaries seeking reinvasion of Korea is another main factor that drives the tension of the peninsula to the brink of war.
					
					 The reality clearly shows that their anachronistic cooperation with foreign forces is unpardonable treachery of destroying the north-south relations and bringing dark clouds of a nuclear war to the peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Scenario for Bio-Chemical Warfare Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Scenario for Bio-Chemical Warfare Flayed
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean warlike forces staged "a combined chemical, biological and radioactive exercises" on March 3 as part of Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This brings into light a criminal scenario to attack the DPRK with biochemical weapons in "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula, while peddling the story about the non-existent "threat from the north."    The warmongers at home and abroad claim that the joint military exercises put emphasis on the exercises designed to cope with "attacks with WMDs" including "combined chemical, biological and radioactive exercises" but this is nothing but sophism to paint their saber-rattling as "defensive."
					
					 The north-targeted "combined chemical, biological and radioactive exercises" staged by the south Korean authorities in collusion with the U.S. are a grave challenge to the dialogue between the north and the south and the peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The prevailing situation goes to prove that the south Korean warmongers are not standing for dialogue and peace but working hard to do harm to the DPRK by force of arms at any cost by employing all means and methods including nuclear weapons and bio-chemical weapons. 
					
					 We love peace and value the inter-Korean relations but we will not pardon the war maniacs making desperate efforts to do harm to the DPRK.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blasts Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islets
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blasts Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islets
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, former Japanese Foreign Minister Maehara at the Diet session uttered that "Tok islets have been under control by other country without a legal ground" and Chief Cabinet Secretary Edano raised a claim to the islets, blustering that "there is no other country which is in a position to establish a real domination over the islets from the historical and legal view points."
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are persistently raising a claim to Tok islets, citing what they call legal ground. This is aimed to reduce the islets to a territorial dispute-torn area in a bid to internationalize the issue and, furthermore, to secure a legitimate pretext for staging a comeback to Korea.
					
					 Their recent moves to grab the islets have gone beyond limit.
					
					 This year the Shimane Prefectural government of Japan held an event to justify Japan's claim to Tok islets, talking about the "Takeshima Day".
					
					 In another development, dozens of Japanese staged a farce of transferring their domicile of origin to the islets while insisting that the islets belong to Japan though they are part of the inviolable territory of Korea. 
					
					 This cannot be interpreted otherwise than a clumsy artifice to build public opinion asserting that the islets belong to Japan.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' moves to grab Tok islets are just a prelude to a war of reinvasion against Korea.

articles.title: Korean Women to Demonstrate Revolutionary Stamina Called for
articles.content:
Korean Women to Demonstrate Revolutionary Stamina Called for
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday editorially calls upon all the Korean women to fully demonstrate their revolutionary stamina in the general onward drive to open a gate to a thriving nation.
					 The Korean women enjoy good luck as they have carved out their destinies, leading a worthwhile life under the care of the great leader and the great party, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 The shining Korean women's movement originated from the formation of the Anti-Japanese Women's Association, the first Korean women's revolutionary organization, under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The Korean women have exercised equal rights with men since the President formed the Democratic Women's Union of Korea and promulgated the law on sex equality.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il published many works, making sure that the immortal feats performed by the President before the women's movement have been exalted. He also led the women to display their responsibility and role in the society and the revolutionary development.
					
					 Excellent is the ideological and moral world of the Korean women who have grown up under the care of the great leader and the great party.
					
					 The women play their role in the on-going drive for the great revolutionary surge with patriotism and loyalty and indomitable will. This include the women soldiers reliably defending the defense line of the country, firmly holding the arms of the revolution, the women at the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex working hard to increase Juche-iron production along with smelters, women scientists doing their shares to make a breakthrough in the development of cutting-edge science and technology.

articles.title: DPRK, Japan Quite Different in Outlook on Children
articles.content:
DPRK, Japan Quite Different in Outlook on Children
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- It was reported by the Rodong Sinmun newspaper in January that first triplets in the new year were born at the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, in the wake of the birth of quadruplets late last year.
					 The birth of triplets and quadruplets is a synonym for happiness and blessings in the DPRK.
					
					  At least 380 babies were born at the hospital in the first week of January.
					
					 Planes are mobilized to bring women pregnant with triplets to hospitals and after birth, the babies are presented with gold rings and silver-decorated knives and placed under the care of the state.
					
					 On the contrary, an increasing number of married women do not want to give birth to babies in Japan.
					
					 What is worse, some of the children are maltreated by their parents in the country.
					
					 Last year, a Japanese newspaper reported that a two-year-old boy was thrown into a refuse bin and choked to death by his father in Tokyo and a two-year-old girl was scalded in legs by her mother.
					
					 According to a recent survey, more than 40,000 abuses against children are reported in Japan a year.

articles.title: Application of Tuition-waiver Program to Korean Schools in Japan Called for
articles.content:
Application of Tuition-waiver Program to Korean Schools in Japan Called for
						
Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Professors of Japanese Universities including Hitotsubashi University visited the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology on March 4 and handed it a written request addressed to the Prime Minister, the minister and the chief Cabinet secretary of Japan in demand of the prompt application of the tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools.
					 The request said that extreme discrimination against the Korean schools only is unpardonable.
					
					 It accused the Japanese government of suspending the procedures for applying the program to the Korean schools, while vociferating about the Yonphyong Island shelling incident.
					
					 It expressed concern over the fact that a series of measures taken by the local self-government bodies including Tokyo Metropolis and Osaka Prefecture are inflicting double damage upon the patrons who send their children to the Korean schools.
					
					 It demanded that the program be immediately applied to them.
					
					 Meanwhile, members of the "For Achieving Peace through Dialogue! the Kobe Network for Japan-DPRK Relations," Japanese citizens and compatriots held a rally in Kobe on Feb. 27 at which they adopted resolutions addressed to the foreign minister and the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan.

articles.title: Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Lambasted
articles.content:
Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Lambasted
						
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Kang Chu Ryon, chairwoman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, issued a statement on March 5 denouncing the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet war-like forces for staging the war maneuvers against the DPRK.
					 It is the Koreans who will suffer disasters, if a war breaks out in the Korean Peninsula, the statement said, declaring that the war maniacs would never be pardoned for ruthlessly trampling down upon the will of the mothers to bring their children a hope-filled future.
					
					 All the Korean women in Japan bitterly condemn the war maneuvers, branding them as a thrice-cursed crime against the nation and peace, it stressed.

articles.title: Halt to Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Called for
articles.content:
Halt to Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Called for
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan issued a statement on March 2 demanding the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors stop at once the psychological warfare and war maneuvers against the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 They kicked off the joint military exercises across south Korea with huge armed forces involved. This is a revelation of the vicious intention to stifle the DPRK by force of arms, opposed to peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove the real aim sought by the south Korean group of traitors in deliberately bringing to rupture the hard-won north-south military dialogue to defuse the military tensions on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The statement demanded the U.S. and the south Korean group of traitors stop at once the joint military exercises for aggression on the DPRK.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Blasted
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Blasted
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian Federation of Transport Trade Unions released a statement on March 3 denouncing the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for their Key Resolve and Foal Eagle large-scale war maneuvers against the DPRK.
					 Key Resolve and Foal Eagle prove that the U.S. military strategy to establish military hegemony in Northeast Asia has already entered a practical stage, the statement said.
					
					 It demanded the U.S. and south Korea stop at once the joint military exercises and accept the DPRK's sincere proposal for dialogue.
					
					 We extend firm solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country and achieve its peaceful reunification, it stressed.

articles.title: Mexican Organization Issues Bulletin
articles.content:
Mexican Organization Issues Bulletin
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism in its bulletin No. 52 carried a photo on the single-minded unity of the Korean people.
					 The bulletin in an article titled "The single-minded unity of the DPRK" said that it is the DPRK where a harmonious whole of the leader and the people serves as a fundamental cornerstone of the state political system and all the people share will and destiny with their leader.
					
					 The single-minded unity is the main factor that makes socialist Korea remain unshaken in any political upheaval and the main source of the strength to bring about miraculous events in which everything impossible is made possible, the bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 The single-minded unity is the bottom-line of the tremendous strength of the DPRK which does not fear any formidable enemy.
					
					 There are in the DPRK the Korean People's Army which achieved the unity between officers and men and combined military affairs with politics on the best level under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il. There is also in the DPRK the great unity between the army and the people that have attained unity in thinking and work style on the road of upholding the leader.
					
					 The single-minded unity based on the loyalty to the leader and the great unity between the army and the people serve as the source of strength to encourage all of them to display the spirit of devotedly defending the leader, the spirit of defending the country unto death and the matchless self-sacrificing spirit, it stressed.

articles.title: Xu Caihou Refers to Successfully Building Party Organizations in Army
articles.content:
Xu Caihou Refers to Successfully Building Party Organizations in Army
 Beijing, March 6 (KCNA) -- Xu Caihou, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China, called for having a firm grasp on the building of party organizations at different levels in the army, during his recent inspection of units stationed in Beijing to study work there.  
					 He said that to carry out this work well is essential for meeting various challenges and ensuring the absolute leadership of the party over the army. He underscored the need for the units at different levels to strengthen the building of the leadership of the party committees by regarding it as a fundamental requirement to have a main grasp on acquiring ability and progressive ideas and arm themselves with theories as instructed by President Hu Jintao and the Central Military Commission.
					
					 He called for steadily increasing the creative and combat capabilities of the party organizations by stepping up the construction of grass-roots level party organizations in order to promote the scientific development in building units and provide a firm guarantee for faithfully carrying out the mission of the Chinese army.

articles.title: Russia Steps Up Development of Antimissile Weapons
articles.content:
Russia Steps Up Development of Antimissile Weapons
 Moscow, March 6 (KCNA) -- Russia is directing efforts on the work to develop means for intercepting missiles.
					 The country is now carrying on the work to put the information means of antimissile system on a modern basis and, at the same time, develop promising antimissile weapons for radically increasing the militant capability, said the commander of the Space Armed Forces of Russia.

articles.title: Japanese FM Steps down for Scandal
articles.content:
Japanese FM Steps down for Scandal
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Japanese Foreign Minister Maehara stepped down Sunday for his scandal.
					It was reported that on the same day he met the Prime Minister and tendered his resignation, owning the responsibility for receiving an illegal donation from a foreigner in violation of the political fund regulations and the prime minister accepted it.
					
					 Commenting on the resignation of the Cabinet minister considered as a possible successor to the prime minister for "politics and fund issues" amid acute confrontation between the ruling and opposition forces, Yomiuri Shimbun said that the power faced a serious crisis.

articles.title: UAE Works for Development in Northern Emirates
articles.content:
UAE Works for Development in Northern Emirates
						
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- The United Arab Emirates is planning to develop its northern region.
					 Projects will be pushed under plan to further expand infrastructures of the electric power industry and other fields in this region.  
					
					 The government has allocated 1.6 billion U.S. dollars to fund the development projects.

articles.title: Guinea Develops Mining Industry
articles.content:
Guinea Develops Mining Industry
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- Guinea is channeling efforts into the development of mining industry. 
					 The mining sector contributes 16 percent to the GDP and represents 80 percent of Guinea's export revenue. The Guinean government is taking steps to promote the development of bauxite resources rich in the country while intensifying the state grasp and control over the development of mineral resources. 
					
					 With bauxite reserves of 25 billion tons, Guinea has two-thirds of the world's total.

articles.title: Crime Rate Drops in Malaysia
articles.content:
Crime Rate Drops in Malaysia
 Pyongyang, March 7 (KCNA) -- Malaysia's positive combat against crimes proved successful. 
					 Crime rate in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia's capital, has dropped significantly in 2010.
					
					 Overall crime was 19.3 percent lower compared to a year ago. 
					
					 The Kuala Lumpur Police Chief told reporters this on Thursday.

articles.title: Anecdotes about Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Anecdotes about Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, March 8 (KCNA) -- It was on the evening of March 8, Juche 35 (1946) that President Kim Il Sung entered a room where a film show was to begin.
					 The President asked the film operator what kind of movie was ready for the women's holiday.
					
					 The operator answered it was a movie picturing women in their courageous struggle against enemy.
					
					 The President was very pleased to hear that, saying it would be suitable for the International Women's Day.
					
					 He then recalled that women guerrillas fought bravely during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 Though he was very busy building a new country, he personally sponsored a film show and enjoyed it with women officials on the occasion of the women's day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion conjunta Corea-Rusia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion conjunta Corea-Rusia
Pyongyang, 8 de marzo (ATCC) -- Con motivo del Dia Internacional de la Mujer (8 de marzo), el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, presencio el dia 7 en el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang Este con las funcionarias la funcion conjunta de la Banda Samjiyon del Conjunto Artistico Mansudae y de la Orquesta del Siglo 21 de Rusia.
					Le acogieron en el teatro el jefe y director principal de la orquesta rusa, Pavel Ovsyannikov, la gerente administrativa de la misma banda, Nataliya Semyonova, y el embajador ruso en Corea, Valery Sukhinin.
					
					El Dirigente dio calida bienvenida a la orquesta rusa y departio con los huespedes rusos en un ambiente cordial. 
					
					Cuando el Dirigente aparecio en el palco, los espectadores lo acogieron hospitalariamente expresandole el maximo honor y el mas calido agradecimiento en testimonio de infinita veneracion de todas las mujeres del pais. 
					
					El Dirigente abrio la era de prosperidad del movimiento femenino de Corea, formo a las coreanas como verdaderas duenas de la revolucion y la construccion y les aseguro una vida digna y feliz.
					
					El Dirigente dio calurosas felicitaciones a las funcionarias que acogen el Dia Internacional de la Mujer y envio su cordial saludo a todas las coreanas quienes en todos los sectores de construccion de la gran potencia prospera muestran el impetu revolucionario de la mujer coreana y registran relevantes meritos en los anales de la patria. 
					
					Le acompanaron en ver la funcion los cuadros del partido, el Estado y el ejercito: Kim Jong Un, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Hong Sok Hyong, Yang Hyong Sop, Kim Kyong Hui, Kang Sok Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk y Kim Rak Hui, las miembros y miembros suplentes del Comite Central del PTC y las diputadas a la Asamblea Popular Suprema en la ciudad de Pyongyang, la presidenta del CC de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea, Ro Song Sil, y otras funcionarias de esta entidad, las benemeritas laborales de fabricas y empresas capitalinas, las escritoras, periodistas, locutoras, creadoras y artistas. 
					
					Tambien se distinguian el embajador de la Federacion Rusa en Corea y su esposa, y los diplomaticos oficiales de la sede diplomatica rusa en Corea. 
					
					En la escena se presentaron las piezas de diferentes generos, entre otras, el coro mixto "Himno a la mujer de la epoca del Songun", el sexteto femenino y coro "La mujer es la flor", el solo masculino "Mi madre" y "La luz primaveral de amor", la musica folclorica "Tondollari", el solo masculino y pangchang "Mi esposa", el coro "Adelante hacia el futuro maravilloso", las canciones de la ex URSS como el duo mixto "Muguete" y el octeto mixto "Brindis", el cuarteto mixto de una cancion italiana, el solo femenino de la cancion mexicana "Bamboleo", etc.
					
					En la ocasion actuaron los artistas del Pueblo, los Benemeritos, los ganadores de concursos internacionales y otros celebres directores, ejecutantes y cantantes de ambos paises.
					
					La funcion arranco la efusiva ovacion del publico por su alto nivel artistico y magnifica interpretacion. 
					
					Terminada la funcion, el Dirigente respondio a las estruendosas aclamaciones de ejecutantes y espectadores y les felicito por la exitosa funcion. 
					
					Luego, se reunio con los directivos de la banda rusa y les agradecio profundamente por la excelente funcion conjunta que alegro y estimulo mucho a las mujeres coreanas que celebran significativamente el Dia Internacional de la Mujer.

articles.title: Presidente del CC de ACR propone de nuevo contacto de trabajo N-S
articles.content:
Presidente del CC de ACR propone de nuevo contacto de trabajo N-S
Pyongyang, 8 de marzo (ATCC) -- El presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea volvio a enviar un aviso a su homologo surcoreano demandandole el contacto de trabajo de cruz roja Norte-Sur para resolver el problema de devolucion de los habitantes norcoreanos retenidos en el Sur de Corea, como ya le habia notificado el dia 7 por la tarde.
					 Es absurda la insistencia de las autoridades surcoreanas en devolver primero a 27 de 31 habitantes nuestros y discutir despues la verificacion de "voluntad libre" de los 4 restantes "sometidos" al decir de ellas, comienza el aviso.
					
					Demanda fuertemente otra vez el regreso de todos 31 habitantes norcoreanos a bordo de su barco y por la misma ruta maritima en que se habian dado a la deriva.
					
					  Apunta que no se puede reconocer el "sometimiento" de 4 personas y hay que verificarlo sin falta en entrevista directa con ellas.
					
					  Exige sostener, como se ha notificado ya, el contacto de trabajo de cruz roja Norte-Sur a las 10 de la manana del dia 9 en la sala de reuniones de la ex Comision de Supervision de Naciones Neutrales en Phanmunjom para realizar la entrevista directa entre 4 personas en cuestion y sus familiares y parientes.
					
					  Prosigue que los funcionarios de cruz roja de la parte Norte acudiran junto con los familiares de 4 personas al contacto considerando que las autoridades surcoreanas lo aceptaron de principio.
					
					  Concluye destacando que no es apropiado celebrar el contacto en una zona surcoreana y conviene a ambas partes la sala de reuniones de la ex Comision de Supervision de Naciones Neutrales en Phanmunjom.

articles.title: Acto central por Dia Internacional de la Mujer
articles.content:
Acto central por Dia Internacional de la Mujer
Pyongyang, 8 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este martes en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acto central dedicado al 101o aniversario del Dia Internacional de la Mujer (8 de Marzo).
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Yang Hyong Sop, vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Choe Ryong Hae, secretario del Comite Central del PTC, la vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros Kim Rak Hui, los funcionarios directivos de organizaciones de masas, las funcionarias e innovadoras laborales.
					
					Fueron invitadas las coreanas en ultramar, las mujeres de embajadas y oficinas de organizaciones internacionales acreditadas en Corea y huespedes extranjeras.
					
					Ro Song Sil, presidenta del Comite Central de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea, en su discurso senalo que durante mas de 100 anos desde la institucion de esa efemeride, han sido consolidadas la unidad y solidaridad internacionales de las mujeres progresistas del mundo en la lucha contra la dominacion y la subyugacion de toda indole y por la independencia nacional y el desarrollo social.
					
					Destaco que bajo la direccion de los grandes hombres sin iguales (el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il), el movimiento femenino de Corea vino avanzando por el camino de victorias y glorias.
					
					En cada periodo y etapa del desarrollo de la revolucion, las mujeres coreanas pudieron manifestar su impetu indoblegable en la lucha por la prosperidad de la patria bajo la esmerada atencion del Presidente, recalco.
					
					Prosiguio que ese movimiento acoge la era de su plena prosperidad gracias a la orientacion del Dirigente.
					
					Estan registradas en cada pagina de la sagrada cronica revolucionaria las proezas imborrables del Dirigente quien ha desarrollado el movimiento femenino de Corea como el autoctono que apoya fielmente la causa revolucionaria del Songun del PTC, recordo.
					
					Por ultimo, preciso que las coreanas deben cumplir su mision y tareas en la lucha por defender el socialismo y lograr la prosperidad de la patria.

articles.title: Agitacion economica contribuye a la produccion de carbon
articles.content:
Agitacion economica contribuye a la produccion de carbon
Pyongyang, 8 de marzo (ATCC) -- En todos los escenarios de lucha por producir un gran auge se libra intensamente la agitacion economica.
					En la semana pasada, las entidades artisticas centrales, los grupos de propaganda artistica de las provincias, ciudades, distritos (o municipios) acudieron a las principales minas de carbon en las zonas de Sunchon, Tokchon y Kangdong.
					
					Al frente de esta labor, estan el grupo de agitacion economico-artistica central y los grupos de propaganda artistica de obreros del CC de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea y del CC de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea.
					
					Mientras tanto, los artistas del Conjunto Operistico Mar de Sangre, el Conjunto Nacional de Arte Tradicional, el Conjunto Dramatico Nacional y el Conjunto Circense de Pyongyang ofrecieron las funciones de piezas humoristicas al pie de galerias.
					
					Estimulados por la agitacion economica muy llamativa, los carboneros sobrecumplen el plan de produccion.
